Posts.Content: I am so sorry to hear of the very rough time you have had - thank you for the warning - I was on Arimidex for about 13 months, had extreme bone pain that got progressively worse, I'm on Femora now, since Jan 2015. I'm 54 & my family does have a history of heart problems, I'm going to watch for this. I'm praying you will grow strong and healthy (my friend who had leukemia gave me these words when I ended up in the hospital after chemo overdose) thank you again!!!
Posts.Title: arimidex and heart disease

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for you post, I have been on Arimidex for since Dec. 1, 2013;  had mastectomy last May & 15 rounds of chemo - just lateley I'm having joint pain in my hands and bone pain, I've been taking calcium w/ vitamin D but I'm going to try your plan, I have 1000 unit tablets of it so I'll take that twice a day and continue the calcium, so glad I saw this, thought I was crazy - :) ps I probably am crazy but want to give this a good shot, my oncologist recommends it for 5 years
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: Hi there, I'm new to this site, just looked up "joint pain w/ armimidex" and found it, I had double mastectomy in 2013 followed by chemo, no radiation; have been on arimidex now about 6 1/2 months, joint pain in my hands and bone pain, my next oncologist appt. is July 10, I'm curious if I could quit this and get on with my life, I'm a very positive/optimistic person (yes there have been rough/down days, as everyone who's had cancer can attest to) but this has really slowed me way down, I thought it was just me, sometimes I fell like I'm 90 (I'm 54) thanks for listening - Jo
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: On Nov 19, 2015 2:39 PM dixieEQ wrote: Well, I am now two months Arimidex free.  Very minimal pain in joints, bones, and muscles.  No zombie fatigue syndrome.  No depression.  I actually feel like "ME" again for the first time since cancer diagnosis and subsequent Arimidex regimen. I have not seen my onco doctor since stopping the drug but I do intend to have a discussion with him about this at my next appointment in December. I am now on Tamoxifin after being full of pain while on Arimidex - joint and bone pain was awful.  Side effects of Tamoxifin so minor for me, compared to Arimidex and one other drug my oncologist tried before this one.  Best of luck to you! So glad you are feeling better!
Posts.Title: Side Effects of Arimidex After Almost 2 Years

Posts.Content: I am so very sorry to hear about the loss of your friend - my heart hurts for you - please be good to yourself right now and know she loved you - she spoke to you a week before she died so to me, it says she was happy to talk to you and hear from you - death makes no sense but we have the gift of every new day - I went throught treatment for breast cancer last year, I am thankful for every day - I try to make every day count - I believe your friend is with God, this is my personal belief, and that you will see her again one day, hopefully you live a long life and find love and happiness, I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers - again, I'm so sorry for you sadness and hurt, it is very hard to lose a friend.
Posts.Title: MY FRIEND DIED ON SUNDAY IM LOST.

Posts.Content: I am so very sorry to hear about the loss of your friend - my heart hurts for you - please be good to yourself right now and know she loved you - she spoke to you a week before she died so to me, it says she was happy to talk to you and hear from you - death makes no sense but we have the gift of every new day - I went throught treatment for breast cancer last year, I am thankful for every day - I try to make every day count - I believe your friend is with God, this is my personal belief, and that you will see her again one day, hopefully you live a long life and find love and happiness, I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers - again, I'm so sorry for you sadness and hurt, it is very hard to lose a friend.
Posts.Title: MY FRIEND DIED ON SUNDAY IM LOST.

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear about your Mom, this is heartbreaking, please don't let anyone guilt you into feeling bad about not taking the chemo, I agree, get a second opinion, or at least a more compassionate Dr.! I had stage 2 breast cancer (March 2013) I did have the chemo, it almost killed me (I'm 54) and I switched oncologist after the first one over dosed me (even the 2nd oncologist agreed about this, I was just glad it didn't kill me).  I'm sorry you are having such a rough time with your sweet Mom - Jo
Posts.Title: re: answers help
